chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce S Forster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
The Court has no objection to transfer of supervision.
PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 12/12/14 AT 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surchargs, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and DNA surcharge, supervision fees as determined by DOC during period of probation or civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain employment.  Daily work, community service of VA programming.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Jennifer M.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Restitution set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce S Forster

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bruce S Forster in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Monica Shepherd also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.   mld

Defendant Bruce S Forster in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 AS TO CHARGE: Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Jennifer M.  
* Obtain and maintain employment. 
   Daily work, community service of VA programming.  
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and DNA surcharge, supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 12-12-2014 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (not filed by defense counsel).
***The Court has no objection to transfer of supervision.  mld

Defendant Bruce S Forster in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Jaclyn Schwartz (under the student practice rule).  
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Domestic Abuse Repeater (939.621(1)(b)&(2).  

AS TO CHARGE (w/o Domestic Abuse Repeater), Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 9-4-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Court ordered all conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Bruce S Forster in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-8-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Bruce S Forster in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Evan Glaberson appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of prior convictions and service on defendant.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Benitez.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   Discovery turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-10-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail and the no contact order are continued until further order of the Court.   mld
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jennifer M. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bruce S Forster in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Bruce S Forster in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
